plugins.name: CSV to Components – Auto Layout Importer
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to import a CSV file and automatically map each cell’s text content into a predefined component from your local file or library. Whether you’re building tables, lists, or tag grids, this tool saves hours of manual work.


🔧 Key Features:

•Import and preview CSV files

•Map each cell to a selected Figma component

•Auto-detect text layers or select manually

•Preserve internal elements like icons and checkboxes

•Arrange components using Auto Layout (Grid, Vertical, or Horizontal)

•Customize horizontal and vertical spacing


Perfect for designers working with structured data, mockups, or large-scale component-based layouts.


🚫 Note: This plugin works with text-only data and supports one text field per component instance.
plugins.tagline: Easily turn your CSV data into beautifully structured Figma components.

plugins.name: Component State Mapper
plugins.description:
Tired of getting lost in complex component variants? Struggling to track every possible state, prevent design inconsistencies, and explain component logic to your team?


Introducing State Mapper, the essential Figma plugin that transforms your complex component sets into clear, interactive, and easy-to-understand visual maps. Stop navigating your variants blindfolded and gain a bird's-eye view of your entire component architecture.


With a single click, State Mapper instantly generates a live flowchart of all your variants, showing you exactly how they connect and what properties change between them.


Key Features:


  2. 🗺️ Instant Visual Mapping: Automatically generate beautiful, easy-to-read diagrams from any component set. See the full picture, from simple buttons to complex data tables.
  3. 🔬 Powerful Filtering & Layouts: Is your map too complex? No problem. Isolate exactly what you need by filtering properties and values. Switch between Hierarchical, Graph, and Matrix layouts to find the perfect view.
  4. ⚠️ Smart "Missing State" Detection: Our most powerful feature! State Mapper intelligently analyzes your component's properties and automatically flags potential "holes" or missing variants in your system, helping you prevent bugs before they happen.
  5. 🤝 Seamless Handoff & Documentation: Export your component maps as SVG or PNG to include them directly in your documentation on Confluence, Notion, or Jira. Make sure developers understand the logic perfectly.
  6. 🔄 Live Sync: Keep your map updated in real-time. As you add, remove, or change variants, your map reflects those changes instantly.

Who is it for?


State Mapper is built for meticulous Product Designers, UI/UX Designers, and Design System teams who want to build more robust, error-free, and well-documented components.


Install State Mapper today and bring order, clarity, and intelligence to your design system!
plugins.tagline: Bring clarity to component chaos.

plugins.name: UX Buddy
plugins.description:
Transform your design process with instant, expert-level UX feedback.


UX Buddy is your personal design critic that never sleeps. This powerful Figma plugin analyzes your frames and provides instant, actionable feedback based on proven UX principles and industry best practices.


What UX Buddy Does:

✨ **Instant UX Analysis** - Get comprehensive design feedback in seconds, not hours

🎯 **Actionable Insights** - Receive specific, implementable recommendations to improve your designs

🎨 **Visual Design Review** - Analyze color usage, typography, spacing, and visual hierarchy

📱 **Accessibility Checks** - Ensure your designs meet accessibility standards and guidelines

🚀 **Workflow Integration** - Seamlessly integrates into your existing Figma workflow


Key Features:

- **Smart Color Analysis** - Detect contrast issues and color harmony problems

- **Typography Review** - Identify font pairing, hierarchy, and readability issues

- **Layout Evaluation** - Analyze spacing, alignment, and visual balance

- **UX Best Practices** - Get feedback based on established design principles

- **Detailed Reports** - Receive comprehensive analysis with prioritized recommendations

- **Real-time Feedback** - Instant analysis as you design


Perfect For:

- **Product Designers** looking to validate their design decisions

- **UX/UI Designers** wanting to ensure best practices

- **Design Teams** seeking consistent quality standards

- **Freelancers** who need expert-level feedback

- **Students** learning design principles


How It Works:

1. Select any frame in your Figma file

2. Click the UX Buddy plugin

3. Get instant, expert-level analysis

4. Implement suggested improvements

5. Create better user experiences


**Professional-grade analysis** - Providing comprehensive design critique and UX insights based on industry standards and proven methodologies.


Stop guessing about your design decisions. Let UX Buddy guide you toward creating exceptional user experiences that delight and convert.

accepted.name: Opeyemi Ajagbe
accepted.description: I craft digital products that empower people and drive business growth.

plugins.tagline: Expert UX analysis that makes your designs better, instantly.

plugins.name: CopySpark - AI Copywriter
plugins.description:
CopySpark – is an AI-powered Figma plugin built for designers. Powered by ChatGPT and Gemini, it helps you write clear, effective UX copy without leaving your canvas.


✨ Easily write new content from scratch.

🔁 Instantly generate alternative versions.

⚡ Work faster with AI instructions tailored to your tone and context.


Say goodbye to blank text boxes — let AI help you craft and iterate copy in seconds!


How to Use

  1. Choose your AI model – ChatGPT or Gemini.
  2. Enter your API key for the selected model.
  3. Select a text layer in your Figma file.
  4. Choose whether to generate alternatives for the selected text or write new copy from a prompt.
  5. Click “Go” to generate options, then click the version you like to insert it into your text layer.


Get Gemini API Key

Get ChatGPT API Key
plugins.tagline: AI copywriting powered by ChatGPT & Gemini! Write and iterate with ease!

plugins.name: ぼかし背景ジェネレーター
plugins.description:
# Image Aspect Ratio & Background Blur Generator Plugin


## Overview


This Figma plugin automatically generates a new frame from selected images (or rectangles with image fills),

with a **specified aspect ratio and width, and a blurred background**.


- Useful for creating SNS thumbnails and other aspect-ratio-fixed images

- Supports batch processing of multiple images at once


---


## Main Features


- **Aspect Ratio & Width Customization**

Choose from custom ratios or presets (16:9, 4:3, 1:1, etc.). You can freely specify the width (px).


- **Background Blur Effect**

The original image is enlarged and blurred as the background, with the original image centered. Blur strength and scale are adjustable.


- **Batch Processing**

Select multiple images or rectangles with image fills and generate all at once.


- **Automatic Saving & Restoration of Settings**

Your last-used settings are saved in Figma's clientStorage and automatically restored on next launch.


- **Japanese UI**

Intuitive and easy-to-use Japanese interface.


---


## How to Use


1. **Select images or rectangles with image fills**

Multiple selection is supported.


2. **Launch the plugin**

Set the aspect ratio, width, blur strength, and scale in the UI.


3. **Click the "Create" button**

A new frame with the specified ratio, width, and blurred background will be generated to the right of the selected image(s).


4. **Notification**

Success and error messages are shown at the bottom of the UI with color distinction.


---


## Notes


- Non-image nodes are automatically skipped.

- Settings are saved per Figma file.


---


## Data Security


- This plugin does **not** send any user data, images, or personal information to external servers.

- All settings are stored locally using Figma's `clientStorage` API.

- No external API or server communication is performed.


---


# 背景ブラー＆アスペクト比固定の画像生成プラグイン


## 概要


この Figma プラグインは、選択した画像（または画像 fill を持つ矩形）から、

**指定したアスペクト比・幅で新しいフレームを作成し、背景をブラー（ぼかし）化した画像を自動生成**します。


- SNS 用サムネイルやサムネイル画像の自動生成に便利です

- 複数画像を一括で処理できます


---


## 主な機能


- **アスペクト比・幅の指定**

カスタム比率やプリセット（16:9, 4:3, 1:1 など）から選択可能。幅（px）も自由に指定できます。


- **背景ブラー効果**

元画像を拡大・ぼかして背景にし、中央に元画像を配置します。ブラー強度や拡大率も調整可能。


- **複数画像の一括処理**

複数の画像や画像 fill を持つ矩形を選択して一括で生成できます。


- **前回の設定値を自動保存・復元**

設定値は Figma の clientStorage に保存され、次回起動時に自動で復元されます。


- **日本語 UI**

直感的で使いやすい日本語インターフェース。


---


## 使い方


1. **画像または画像 fill を持つ矩形を選択**

複数選択も可能です。


2. **プラグインを起動**

UI でアスペクト比・幅・ブラー強度・拡大率を設定します。


3. **「作成」ボタンをクリック**

選択画像の右隣に、指定した比率・幅・ブラー背景付きの新しいフレームが自動生成されます。


4. **通知**

成功・エラーは画面下部に色分けして表示されます。


---


## 注意点


- 画像以外のノードは自動的にスキップされます。

- 設定値は Figma ファイルごとに保存されます。


---


## データセキュリティ


- 本プラグインはユーザーのデータや画像、個人情報を外部サーバーに一切送信しません。

- 設定値はFigmaの`clientStorage`機能を用いてローカル環境のみに保存されます。

- 外部APIや外部サーバーとの通信は一切行いません。
plugins.tagline: 選択した画像から、指定したアスペクト比・幅で背景をブラー（ぼかし）化した画像を自動生成します。

plugins.name: Blueprint
plugins.description:
Blueprint is a UX documentation tool that helps create UX flows & development instructions lightning fast. Just import your Figma designs to Blueprint and create UX flows on its grid-based canvas.

Visit blueprintapp.design to learn more about Blueprint!


Key features:

  1. Import Figma design: Import selected frames or the entire page.
  2. Grid canvas: Arrange and organize Figma frames super fast.
  3. UX flowchart: Draw UX flows with arrows and diagrams using Figma designs, making it easier to communicate with your teammates.
  4. Add annotations: Write down instructions or detailed guidance about a selected scene for clearer communications.


To get started:

  1. Install the Plugin from the Figma Community
  2. Enter your Figma File URL
  3. Choose specific Frames or import all Frames to Blueprint
  4. Click the "Open on Blueprint" button to begin designing your UX flows
plugins.tagline: High-fidelity UX Flows Made Effortless

plugins.name: SheetSync For DeSo
plugins.description:
SheetSync For DeSo: Spreadsheets to Figma Design Variations


Tired of manual data entry in Figma? SheetSync For DeSo revolutionizes your workflow by letting you populate design frames directly from your data sources.

Effortlessly generate multiple design variations, product cards, user profiles, and more by connecting to:

  1. Google Sheets (Public Links)
  2. Local CSV/XLSX Files

Rename your Figma text and image layers to match your spreadsheet headers (e.g., #product_name, #image_url), select your template frame, and let SheetSync do the rest! It even includes robust image fetching with retry options.
plugins.tagline: Design at Scale, Sheet to Shape

plugins.name: Feed Names, Get Frames (16:9, 1280x720)
plugins.description:
This plugin allows to batch-create 1280*720px (16:9) frames with user-defined names.


The frames will be created in the centre of the viewport, unless something is in the way — in this case it will place them to the bottom right of the conflicting element, and the frames created will remain selected for further batch manipulation. Frame size works well for YouTube thumbnails.


Useful for established design workflows, especially centred around YouTube design, with high volumes and short turnaround times.


Assuming that 1 manual frame creation+naming takes 5 seconds, then for 10 frames the plugin increases the efficiency by x50. And even more for a larger number of frames.

accepted.name: Alexandra (Sasha) Hunter
accepted.description: I do graphic and product design.

plugins.tagline: Paste a list of titles — get frames with those titles

plugins.name: Remove and select next
plugins.description:
😟 FIGMA NATIVE BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer triggers a global deselect.

Consequently, you need to take your mouse to select the next layer you want to work on.


🥳 PLUGIN BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer select the next layer.

Meaning you don't need to take your mouse back and you can continue to design at the speed of light on your keyboard!


⌨️ KEYBOARD SHORTCUT

Plugins can't have keyboard shortcuts so you'll have to set it on your own.

See this page for a tutorial on macOS native keyboard shortcuts and BetterTouchTools

plugins.name: comodo exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you rename and export layers named $IMG in your Figma project based on special tags. You can choose between two workflows:

  1. Destructive export: Layers are renamed and export settings applied (JPG, PNG, SVG, @1x, @2x, @3x). Once renamed, the original $IMG layers are lost, and the plugin cannot be rerun unless you revert to an earlier version.
  2. Non-destructive export: The plugin creates a new page where it duplicates and renames all matching layers, preserving the original ones. You can delete the new page and restart anytime.

A Figma template will soon be provided with pre-set tags and an organized layout to make your workflow faster and more reliable. More detailed documentation will also follow.
plugins.tagline: Rename & export $IMG layers via tags. Template & docs coming soon for easy setup.

plugins.name: Figma Copilot
plugins.description:
Figma Copilot is your AI design partner that allows u to chat with AI about selected frames, components, or anything else on your Figma file. It is built to help you create better, more accessible, and more consistent products faster than ever. Stop guessing and start refining your work with expert-level feedback, right inside Figma.


Key Features

  1. Instant Design Reviews: Select any frame, component, or element and get immediate, actionable feedback on UI, UX, and accessibility.
  2. Expert-Level Heuristics: Powered by leading AI models, Copilot analyzes your work against established design principles like hierarchy, contrast, and consistency, acting as your personal UI/UX Design Expert.
  3. Use Your Own AI: Bring your own API key for your preferred provider: OpenAI (gpt-4o-mini), Google (gemini-1.5-flash), or Anthropic (claude-3-haiku) - stored locally on your computer.
  4. Context-Aware Analysis: The feedback is intelligently tailored to the specific element you've selected, whether it's a full user flow, a single button, or a text block.


How It Helps You

  1. Ship Faster: Catch common design issues before handoff.
  2. Improve Accessibility: Ensure your designs meet modern standards and are usable by everyone.
  3. Learn Best Practices: Get feedback grounded in proven design principles.
  4. Break Creative Blocks: Use the AI as a brainstorming partner to explore new ideas.


Install Figma Copilot today and elevate your design workflow!
plugins.tagline: Instant AI feedback on UI, UX, and accessibility.

plugins.name: Bulk Text Replacer
plugins.description:
CSV形式のファイルを読み込んで一括置換できます。

1列目に検索対象、2列目に置換内容を記述したCSVファイルを読み込ませて使用して下さい。


手入力で「検索する言葉」と「置換する言葉」の間に「=>」を入れることでも可能です。

例：検索する言葉 => 置換する言葉


You can perform bulk text replacement by importing a CSV file.

The first column should contain the text to search for, and the second column should contain the replacement text.


Alternatively, you can manually enter replacement pairs using the => format.

Example: original text => replacement text
plugins.tagline: Bulk text replacement for Figma, Figjam & Slides.

plugins.name: Design to System
plugins.description:
Design to System is a Figma plugin that helps you convert your existing designs into a structured design system — effortlessly.

With just a few clicks, you can extract styles from your design, register them as local styles, and reapply them consistently across your file.


Key Features

  1. 🔍 Analyze Selection : Extracts all design style properties (colors, text styles, shadows) from the selected layers. Color values are automatically categorized into background, text, and stroke styles for easier organization.
  2. 📌 Register Styles : Registers the extracted styles into your Figma local styles panel. This enables consistent reuse and supports design system creation.
  3. 🎯 Apply Styles : Applies the registered local styles back to the selected design elements — ensuring consistency and systemization.
plugins.tagline: Turn your designs into a reusable system – automatically.

plugins.description:
1. Select one or more layers in your Figma file (the plugin will find all text layers within your selection).
  2. Open the plugin and enter your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/4936850-where-do-i-find-my-openai-api-key
  3. Type a prompt or instruction describing the kind of text you want (e.g., “US zip code”, “company name”, “city in Japan”).
  4. Click "Generate Text". Each selected text layer will be filled with a unique, AI-generated response matching your instruction.

plugins.name: JSON Frame Mapper
plugins.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.


---


This plugin is completely free so feel free to not buy me a [coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/shragor)


Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider 🤔


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data


Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- On successfully loading a JSON, it will display the number of items and fields such as ```25 items with 23 fields loaded```

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets → Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field
plugins.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin allows users to load images and data from their local development servers. Users often run local servers on common ports (3000, 4000, 5000, 8000, 8080, 9000) to serve images, SVG files, and JSON data that they want to import into their Figma designs. Localhost access enables seamless integration with local development workflows and self-hosted content.

137181.release_notes:
Now accepts and imports SVGs.

If an object {{field}} (a rectangle or square, say) is mapped to a SVG, the object will be replaced by a frame containing a group of the SVG. The SVG will be exactly the same size, shape and location (in the design) as the parent {{field}}
137181.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

plugins.name: Token Architect
plugins.description:
Token Architect is a comprehensive design token management solution that bridges the gap between Figma and your development workflow. Create, export, and import design tokens with intelligent automation and bidirectional sync capabilities.


KEY FEATURES:

  1. Generate Complete Token Systems - Create comprehensive design tokens from a single brand colour with automatic shade generation
  2. Smart Color Palette Generation - Transform any colour into professional 100-900 shade scales with HSL-based algorithms
  3. Export Figma Variables - Convert your Figma variables into industry-standard JSON tokens
  4. Import External Tokens - Bring design tokens from popular tools (Style Dictionary, Design Tokens W3C) into Figma
  5. Advanced Token Classification - Automatic organisation into primitives and semantic token hierarchies
  6. Multi-Category Support - Colours, spacing, typography, responsive breakpoints, and semantic tokens
  7. Real-time Preview & Validation - Live JSON output with comprehensive debugging capabilities


PERFECT FOR:

  1. Design system managers building tokens from scratch or maintaining consistency
  2. Frontend developers implementing design tokens in modern frameworks
  3. Teams using tools like Style Dictionary, Tokens Studio, or custom token pipelines
  4. Organisations scaling design systems across products and platforms



Please reach out to ozarg.studio@gmail.com if you have any issues or would like to request a feature. Or let's connect on LinkedIn. Cool ideas welcome :)

accepted.name: OZAR STUDIO
accepted.description: We are a design studio working worldwide . We provide a range of design and development services.
